verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Oh were I at the moss house where the birds do increase At the foot of the Mount Leinster or some silent place Near the streams of Bunclody where all pleasures do meet And all I would ask is one kiss from my sweet.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Oh the cuckoo is a pretty bird and it sings as it flies It brings us good tidings and it tells us no lies It sucks the young birds eggs to make its voice clear And it never cries Cuckoo 'till the summer is near.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Oh if I were a clerk and could write a good hand I would write my love a letter so she'd understand I am a young fellow who's wounded in love I live in Bunclody but now I must leave.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: If I was a singing bird then I would fly To yon shady arbor where my true love does lie I'd sing her a sweet song and maybe she'd cry Then on her soft bosom contented I'd die.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: My love always slights me as you understand Because she has riches and I have no land I'm going to America my fortune to try But when I think on Bunclody I am ready to die.
